title: Extreme Heat Puts Life on Hold in Britain, a Land Not Built for It
abstract: In a country more accustomed to temperate weather, a brutal heat wave tested Britain’s infrastructure and forced millions to choose between a Stygian commute or a stifling home office.

title: Flood, Evacuate, Rinse, Repeat: A Relentless Pattern Batters Australia

title: Plans to Fight Global Warming Face an Obstacle in Paris: Trees
